metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11575 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FontForge 20161012 is vulnerable to a buffer over-read in strnmatch (char.c) resulting in DoS or code execution via a crafted otf file, related to a call from the readttfcopyrights function in parsettf.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fontforge - 20120731.b-5ubuntu0.1
fontforge-common - 20120731.b-5ubuntu0.1
fontforge-nox - 20120731.b-5ubuntu0.1
libfontforge1 - 20120731.b-5ubuntu0.1
libgdraw4 - 20120731.b-5ubuntu0.1
python-fontforge - 20120731.b-5ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fontforge package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20120731.b-5ubuntu0.1').
